A person's vote was often cast in public, not in secret.  The officials would count actual heads in a room, Federalists to one side, Republicans to another. Most of our litigation right now is about expanding that eligibility to vote by mail to include COVID-19 as an excuse and also getting rid of other obstacles to voting by mail.

A lot of states require things like witness signatures or notaries to certify your ballot.  And under normal circumstances, that's an unnecessary hoop to jump through.  During the pandemic, it's downright impossible for a lot of people to comply with while they're also trying to observe social distancing protocols to keep them and their communities safe.

There are a lot of people who are still going to need to go to vote in person.  People with certain kinds of disabilities, for example, can't use an absentee paper ballot. States get rid of extra hurdles to completing your ballot like witness signatures and notaries.  States make sure people who need in-person voting can access it.  And the federal government funds and mandates the expansion of vote-by-mail and early voting.  We need this to protect our right to vote and to protect our democracy.
